hanzi-su-wiki:
監

Значения

Наблюдать; надзирать; контролировать. Тюрьма

Мнемоника

Чиновник 臣, наблюдающий за рабами 人, которые выпаривают в чаше 皿 соль на солеварне. Такие работы считались каторжными.

Варианты

监

heisig_chinese_memo: The slavetrader supervises the slaves washing dishes in the kitchen. No reclining on the floor!
heisig_constituent: oversee, retainer, slave, reclining, lying down, one, floor, dish
Keyword_KANJIDIC: oversee, official, govt office, rule, administer
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: Oversee, официальный, правительство офис, правило, администрировать
koohiiStory1: While the slave-buyer is perusing (perusal (#855)) the stack of slaves reclining on the floor, the slaves' overseer supplies them with dishes of gruel -- don't want the slaves starving to death before they can be sold!
koohiiStory2: The slaves are reclining on the floor when the overseer comes in. They tell him "We´re not goofing off, a dish fell and broke and we´re cleaning it off the floor".
jp_example_words:
監視(かんし): observation, guarding, inspection, surveillance
監督(かんとく): supervision, control, superintendence
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: To the servant you say: "gun, ground, plate." It is your job to oversee everything they do.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You point to the gun. You point to the ground (that's where the gun goes). You point to the plate (you want it). You have to oversee everything the servant does.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Why must you oversee everything? Because you are Genghis Khan (かん), and Genghis Khan oversees everything.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If anyone had to oversee a lot, it was Genghis Khan, who had one of the largest kingdoms in all of history.
Ru_Meaning: oversee, official, govt office, rule, administer
Ru_Notes: Фонетик для некоторых кандзи: 鑑 (かんがみる、カン пример, образчик), 艦 (カン военный корабль).
Ru_trainchinese:
jiān: (графема) наблюдать за, инспектировать; тюрьма
jiàn: (графема) название императорской канцелярии (в древние времена)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the subject (臣) and the one (一) man (𠂉) over the dish (皿) keep watch
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Sitting on the couch in comfort I'm too lazy to get up so I recline and use my fencing foil to reach the dog's dish.  Then I tip it over so he can get the last drop of food which was too hard to get on his own. I love my dog so I supervise constantly to make sure he's okay.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The ancient shamans (or kings) also offered animal sacrifices such as cows or lambs to the gods. These sacrifices were prepared in the huge bronze plates. (監, 监, jian=chien, supervise) This character shows the ceremonial plate, and a figure who is kneeling in front of the plate and watching it very attentively (見, 见, jian=chien, see; meet with). Inside the ceremonial plate, there is a stroke (), which means the sacrifice. This character shows how careful and attentive he is.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The human form is written in Jia Jin inscription to highlight the eyes. A little bit may be added to the " dish ", which refers to a vessel containing water. The whole word means looking after one's reflection in the water dish. The original meaning is to look after one's face by the water, and it also means the name of the vessel, which refers to the container that holds the water to reflect the face. In the later period, the " head " form and body of the inscriptions were changed to the sides of " Chen " and " Ren " respectively, and they were written side by side on the top of the " dish " filled with water. They were based on the small seal character. The regular script "人" becomes " 𠂉 ", and a point like water remains below. Later, because " supervision " mostly meant supervision and surveillance, " gold " was added as a sign, and the characters " jian " and " jian " were made to express the original meaning. In addition to " Jian " and " Jian ", the characters from " Jian " as both sound and symbol also have " Look " which means to watch.

There are two sayings in the usage of oracle bone inscriptions, "Collection" 27742: "Ling Jianfan," Yao Xiaosui believed that " Jian " means surveillance, but did not explain the whole sentence. Liu Xinglong believes that " Jian " is a person's name, and " Fan " is used as a " pan, " which means to play on board, and the whole sentence means to order Jian to go to play. Gu Bei said.

Bronze inscriptions are used as the name of the vessel, and it also means that this vessel used to hold water for care is a utensil before the production of bronze mirrors. The older one can bathe or store ice. Attacking Wu Wang Jian: "The Wu Wang Da (husband) chooses Jue Jijin, and he (as) the imperial supervisor (jian)." This means that Wu Wang Fu Cha chose strong bronze and cast his own daily mirror. He also expressed supervision and praised Ding: "Supervise the new creation". Ma Chengyuan believes that "new creation" is the official name, which means to monitor and manage "new creation" officials.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period said they saw, "Tsinghua Bamboo Slips II. "Lian Nian" Jane 1: "In the past Zhou Dynasty King Wu supervised the King of Shang's unrequited (respectful) God", which means that in the past, King Wu of Zhou saw King Shang being disrespectful to the Emperor of Heaven. Also pass false as " Title ", "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Zigao" Jane 11: "Also (there are) the swallows hold the eggs and the people (all) do not (the) front", which means that some swallows hold the bird's eggs and put them in front of her (referring to Qi's mother) (Ji Xusheng).

"Shuowen": "Supervision, coming down. From lying down, She Shengsheng. 𧨭, supervising ancient prose from words." Xu Shen believes that " supervision " means looking down below, which is an extended meaning of " supervision ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The " monitoring " in the Jiajin inscription is like a person taking care of his face in the water tray. Therefore, the original meaning of " monitoring " is to observe. This type of plate was later called " jian ".
humanum_full_description:
甲金文寫出人形而突顯眼睛，「皿」上或加一點，指盛水的器皿，全字表示在水盤裏照看自己的倒影。本義是臨水照看自己的容顏，又表示器名，指盛水映照面顏的容器。後期金文「目」形和人身分別被改為「臣」和「人」旁，並排寫在盛水的「皿」的上面，為小篆字形所本。楷書「人」旁變為「𠂉」，下面保留象水的一點。後來因為「監」多表示監督、監視，故加「金」為意符，造「鑒」、「鑑」字來表示本義。除了「鑒」、「鑑」，從「監」為聲符兼符的字還有表示觀看的「覽」。

　　甲骨文用法有二說，《合集》27742：「令監凡」，姚孝遂認為「監」表示監視，但沒有解釋全句。劉興隆認為「監」是人名，「凡」用作「盤」，表示盤遊，全句意謂命令監去遊樂。姑備二說。

　　金文用作器名，又表示這種用來盛水照看的器皿，是銅鏡產生以前的用具，大者可以沐浴，亦可用以藏冰。攻吳王鑑：「攻吳王大（夫）差擇厥吉金，自乍（作）御監（鑑）。」意謂吳王夫差選擇堅固的青銅，自己鑄造日用的鑑。又表示監察，頌鼎：「監𤔲（司）新造」，馬承源認為「新造」是官名，意謂監察和管理「新造」這種官員。

　　戰國竹簡表示看見，《清華簡二．繫年》簡1：「昔周武王監觀商王之不龏（恭）上帝」，意謂以往，周武王看見商王對天帝不恭敬。又通假為「銜」，《上博竹書二．子羔》簡11：「又（有）燕銜卵而措者（諸）丌（其）前」，意謂有燕子銜了鳥蛋放到她（指契的母親）的前面（季旭昇）。

　　《說文》：「監，臨下也。从臥，䘓省聲。𧨭，古文監从言。」許慎認為「監」表示俯視下面，是「監」的引申義。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文「監」象人在水盤裏照看自己的容顏，故「監」的本義是察看，這種盤子後來叫做「鑑」。

監視(かんし): observation, guarding, inspection, surveillance
監督(かんとく): supervision, control, superintendence

甲金文寫出人形而突顯眼睛，「 皿 」上或加一點，指盛水的器皿，全字表示在水盤裏照看自己的倒影。本義是臨水照看自己的容顏，又表示器名，指盛水映照面顏的容器。後期金文「 目 」形和人身分別被改為「 臣 」和「 人 」旁，並排寫在盛水的「 皿 」的上面，為小篆字形所本。楷書「 人 」旁變為「 𠂉 」，下面保留象水的一點。後來因為「 監 」多表示監督、監視，故加「 金 」為意符，造「 鑒 」、「 鑑 」字來表示本義。除了「 鑒 」、「 鑑 」，從「 監 」為聲符兼符的字還有表示觀看的「 覽 」。 甲骨文用法有二說，《合集》27742：「令監凡」，姚孝遂認為「 監 」表示監視，但沒有解釋全句。劉興隆認為「 監 」是人名，「 凡 」用作「 盤 」，表示盤遊，全句意謂命令監去遊樂。姑備二說。 金文用作器名，又表示這種用來盛水照看的器皿，是銅鏡產生以前的用具，大者可以沐浴，亦可用以藏冰。攻吳王鑑：「攻吳王大（夫）差擇厥吉金，自乍（作）御監（鑑）。」意謂吳王夫差選擇堅固的青銅，自己鑄造日用的鑑。又表示監察，頌鼎：「監𤔲（司）新造」，馬承源認為「新造」是官名，意謂監察和管理「新造」這種官員。 戰國竹簡表示看見，《清華簡二．繫年》簡1：「昔周武王監觀商王之不龏（恭）上帝」，意謂以往，周武王看見商王對天帝不恭敬。又通假為「 銜 」，《上博竹書二．子羔》簡11：「又（有）燕銜卵而措者（諸）丌（其）前」，意謂有燕子銜了鳥蛋放到她（指契的母親）的前面（季旭昇）。 《說文》：「監，臨下也。从臥，䘓省聲。𧨭，古文監从言。」許慎認為「 監 」表示俯視下面，是「 監 」的引申義。

The whole word means looking after one's reflection in the water dish. The original meaning is to look after one's face by the water, and it also means the name of the vessel, which refers to the container that holds the water to reflect the face. In the later period, the " head" form and body of the inscriptions were changed to the sides of" Chen" and " Ren" respectively, and they were written side by side on the top of the " dish" filled with water. They were based on the small seal character. The regular script " 人" becomes " 𠂉", and a point like water remains below. Later, because " supervision" mostly meant supervision and surveillance, " gold" was added as a sign, and the characters " jian" and " jian" were made to express the original meaning. In addition to " Jian" and " Jian", the characters from " Jian" as both sound and symbol also have " Look" which means to watch. There are two sayings in the usage of oracle bone inscriptions, "Collection" 27742: "Ling Jianfan," Yao Xiaosui believed that " Jian" means surveillance, but did not explain the whole sentence. Liu Xinglong believes that " Jian" is a person's name, and " Fan" is used as a " pan," which means to play on board, and the whole sentence means to order Jian to go to play. Gu Bei said. Bronze inscriptions are used as the name of the vessel, and it also means that this vessel used to hold water for care is a utensil before the production of bronze mirrors. The older one can bathe or store ice. Attacking Wu Wang Jian: "The Wu Wang Da (husband) chooses Jue Jijin, and he (as) the imperial supervisor (jian)." Also pass false as " Title", "Shangbo Zhushu II. 監字的基本解释

監
jiān

監
jiàn
均见“监”。

監字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiān］
［《廣韻》古銜切，平銜，見。］
“监1”的繁体字。亦作“譼1”。
(1)察看；督察。
(2)指诸侯。
(3)掌管；主管。
(4)古代指太子或元老重臣代掌朝政。
(5)总领，率领。
(6)看守；囚禁。
(7)监狱。
(8)太阳的一种光象。指日旁似冠珥的赤云气。
[②]［jiàn］
［《廣韻》格懺切，去鑑，見。］
“监2”的繁体字。
(1)古代官名。多指主管监察的官员。
(2)古代官署名称。如牧马监、钦天监等，其主官亦称监或少监。
(3)国子监。
(4)指监生。国子监生员的省称。
(5)太监。
(6)量词。用于书函。
(7)宋代的特别行政区划名。于坑冶、铸钱、牧马、产盐等地区设置。一种与府、州同级，隶属于路；一种与县同级，隶属于府、州。
(8)通“鑒”。镜子。
(9)通“鑒”。照映；明察。
(10)通“鑒”。借鉴；参考。
(11)通“鑒”。儆戒；教训。
(12)通“嚂”。贪求。
(13)姓。春秋齐国有监止。见《史记·

監字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【皿字部】　監； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页796第02
〔古文〕??譼【唐韻】【正韻】古銜切【集韻】【韻會】居銜切，?減平聲。【說文】臨下也。【徐曰】安居以臨下，監之也。【揚子·方言】察也。【廣韻】領也。【詩·小雅】何用不監。【箋】女何用爲職，不監察之。【禮·王制】天子使其大夫爲三監。監於方伯之國。【註】使佐方伯，領諸侯，監臨而督察之也。上監去聲，下監平聲。【周禮·天官·大宰之職】邦國立其監。【註】謂公侯伯子男，各監一國。【莊子·天運篇】監臨下土，天下戴之，此謂上皇。　又【韻府】攝也。【左傳·閔二年】君行則守，守曰監國。　又【韻會小補】觀也。【魯語】長監于世。　又監寐，猶寤寐也。【後漢·桓帝紀】監寐寤嘆。【註】言雖寢而不寐也。　又雲氣臨日也。【周禮·春官】眂祲掌十煇之灋，四曰監。【疏】謂有赤雲氣在日旁，如冠珥。珥，卽耳也。　又星名。【史記·天官書】歲隂在寅，歲星居丑，正月晨出東方，名曰監德。　又【唐韻】格懺切【集韻】【韻會】居懺切【正韻】古陷切，?減去聲。義同。　又【爾雅·釋詁】視也。【書·太甲】天監

Supervise
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiān］
["Guangyun" ancient title cut, flat title, see. ]
The traditional characters of "控1". Also known as "譼1".
(1) Inspection; inspector.
(2) Refers to the princes.
(3) In charge; in charge.
(4) In ancient times, it meant that the prince or the elder and the minister held the government on behalf of the prince.
(5) Chief, lead.
(6) Guard; imprisonment.
(7) Prison.
(8) A light image of the sun. Refers to the scarlet cloud aura that resembles Guan Er next to the sun.
[②]［jiàn］
["Guangyun" confession cut, go to Jian, see. ]
The traditional characters of "控2".
(1) Ancient official names. Refers to officials in charge of supervision.
(2) The name of the ancient official office. Such as the pastoral prison, the Qintian prison, etc., the chief official is also called the prison or the young prison.
(3) The Imperial College.
(4) Refers to supervised students. The provincial name of the student of the Imperial College.
(5) The eunuch.
(6) Quantifiers. Used for letters.
(7) The names of special administrative divisions in the Song Dynasty. Set up in areas such as pit smelting, casting money, animal husbandry, and salt production. One is at the same level as the prefecture and prefecture and belongs to the road; the other is at the same level as the county and subordinate to the prefecture and prefecture.
(8) Through "Jian". mirror.
(9) Through "Jian". Reflect; Observe.
(10) Pass "Jian". Reference; reference.
(11) Pass "Jian". Warning; lesson.
(12) Through "嚂". Greed.
(13) Last name. The Spring and Autumn Period Qi state-owned supervision. See "Historical Records·

Supervise
Name meaning
Nothing.
jiàn, jiān
вм. 监
Radicals: 臣, 一, 皿  (servant, ground, plate, gun)
Meaning Mnemonic
To the servant you say: "gun, ground, plate." It is your job to oversee everything they do.
You point to the gun. You point to the ground (that's where the gun goes). You point to the plate (you want it). You have to oversee everything the servant does.
Reading Mnemonic
Why must you oversee everything? Because you are Genghis Khan (かん), and Genghis Khan oversees everything.
If anyone had to oversee a lot, it was Genghis Khan, who had one of the largest kingdoms in all of history.
